metadata.h1: How Chatbots Can Be Used to Improve Any Business
metadata.description: All of us have been to websites where a little box pops up in the right-hand corner asking us how can I help you. This little box is a chat window designed to answer any questions you may have day or…

all_paragraphs: Chatbots represent a new trend in how people access information, make decisions, and communicate. — Christie Pitts, Verizon Ventures

All of us have been to websites where a little box pops up in the right-hand corner asking us how can I help you. This little box is a chat window designed to answer any questions you may have day or night.
They are designed to help the customer out by not having to wait on hold to speak with a live person. You type in your question and in a few seconds the answer comes out.

One of the best things about chatbots is they are always online and available 24/7. The customer never has to wait for a person to come back from lunch or a bathroom break. This has provided the consumer instant gratification and it will keep them coming back.

Chatbots can be used in numerous ways to improve any business, big or small, in other ways besides customer service. We will discuss some of these in this article but first we will provide a quick definition of what a chatbot is.

A chatbot is a computer program that communicates with a person and automatically engage with received messages. They can be programmed to respond the same way every time or can adapt their responses to fit the situation.

They utilize text messaging, website chat windows and social media messaging platforms like Twitter and Facebook. Today many different companies employ these bots to streamline their customer service. But these can also be used to improve other areas of your business like sale and marketing.
How would they do that, you ask? Well, let’s take a look below.

Chatbots are very versatile and can be applied to different areas of your business. They can automate many conversations that require an employee which would save time and money. We are beginning to see this in the rise of self-checkout at grocery stores and self-serving kiosks at restaurants.
These can be useful in other departments besides customer service like:

Sales is one of the biggest departments that are affected by chatbots. These handy dandy little tools can gather information about a customer that the sales team could use to qualify, and pitch based on the chatbot interaction. They can suggest products, gauge customers interests and help lead them through every part of the sales funnel.

The bots can bring awareness to certain products based on what the customer is looking at on your website. You can customize the chatbot to wait a short bit while the customer looks around and then pop up and ask a basic question like ‘Can I help you find something?’.

Chatbots are not only used to answer customer service questions but can be used as entertainment for customer. They can catch your audience’s attention and learn from the interaction to provide a better experience next time around. The chatbot personalizes the whole interaction experience making the customer visit more enjoyable and memorable.

Since many chatbots are found on social media sites the audience you can reach is limitless. You can reach a new customer base by tapping into a new demographic you may not have known about before. This could expand your marketing efforts to individuals not included earlier.

Chatbots can make your human resources department really hum by doing mundane tasks. They can schedule interviews, shift through resumes, verify credentials and selecting suitable candidates for interviews. This will free up HR to tackle interviewing the candidates, judge a candidate’s attitude and professionalism and determine if they are a cultural fit for the organization.

Once a candidate is selected chatbots can assist with the onboarding process including automating lengthy paperwork. New employees will feel comfort in the fact that they don’t have to approach fellow coworkers at the beginning stage. New employees will be confident and not waste time navigating their way around the company. They will be able to settle in quicker and tackle their responsibilities faster and with more zest.
Now that you know what functions of your company chatbots can assist you in becoming more efficient how could you use them?
About 80% of businesses are planning to incorporate chatbots by the year 2020. — Business Insider

Chatbots can be implemented on your website or on social media sites like Facebook and Twitter. Each of them has its own way of conversing with your potential customer. The people who visit your website will have a broader knowledge of the products and services you offer than on Facebook and Twitter. Social media accounts will differ in demographics and you may have to study them to get a better picture of each. You will have to program your bots accordingly to ask the right questions on either one.
That’s great and all but what chatbots can use to get started on my website and social media? There are a few examples of each listed below.
Chatbots To Use On Your Website

Imperson — this chatbot is conversational and provides authentic and engaging customer chat experiences. The navigator uses relationship memory, NLP user intents and deep dialogue contexts to lead conversations that helps to achieve customers goals. Imperson provides an end-to-end bot solution by hosting and deploying your bot and providing real-time performance updates.

Reply.ai — is one of the most popular AI chatbots on the market. The enterprise-level bot is a building and management software solution that enables companies to improve their customer service. This comes equipped with a dashboard with built-in CRM, machine learning and real-time insights to make the bots smarter as they gather information.

Flow XO — enables you to create intelligent and interactive chatbots without having to learn how to code. The software comes equipped with an easy to use drag and drop editor that you can create logical workflows and connect your chatbot to a variety of software. The bots you construct will interact and work with third party applications such as Salesforce, Google Sheets and more.

Drift — is a conversation-driven chatbot that that businesses with the best leads in real-time. As users interact with this bot, key information can be provided from them like name, email and phone number for sales and marketing to follow up. You can directly message users within the browser or serve them an automated chat experience.
Chatbots To Use On Social Media

Mobile Monkey — is a software solution that helps you build intelligent chatbots that take your Facebook Messenger marketing to the next level. You can manage a number of lead generation activities such as chat blasts, drip campaigns and list building. It allows you to automate your customer service answers to frequently asked questions.

Chatfuel — is one of the most popular chatbot solutions that can help you build a Facebook Messenger bot easily. This allows you to automate your answers to frequently asked questions like Mobile Monkey. It also allows you to jump in the conversation and take control from the chatbot if needed.

ManyChat — helps you create intelligent Facebook Messenger chatbots that could be used for sales, marketing and customer service. The software comes equipped with a visual drag and drop builder making it easy for you to build your own chatbot. You can also automate your Messenger marketing and send messages based on time delays or certain user actions.

Octane AI — this chatbot allows you to set up and customize a bot for your Shopify store in minutes. This software gives you the ability to recover abandoned carts, automatically answer your customers queries, send follow up messages after purchases with shipping information and receipts and much more.

This article was designed to introduce people to chatbots and how they can use them to improve their business. We talked about different areas of your company chatbots could be helpful in growing your business. I showed you a few examples of chatbots you could employ on your own either through your website or a social media channel.

Many companies throughout the world utilize chatbots to automate and streamline their business. These assist in helping companies become more efficient, increase employee engagement and create a positive on-boarding experience. Chatbots free up redundant tasks employees usually tackle to focus on more creative and productive ways to contribute to an organization.
